------=_NextPart_000_004A_01C0E93C.6DCC77C0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I just looked up the distribution, that you can download from www.junit.org.
At least the zipfile I have (still 3.5) does contain the article.
  -----Original Message-----
  From: Andrew Zou [mailto:azou@...]
  Sent: woensdag 30 mei 2001 19:07
  To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
  Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit


  I think this link( http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm)
does not work any more. Does any body know the mirror site or they moved
this page to where.

  Thanks.

  Andrew
    -----Original Message-----
    From: Philippe Vanpeperstraete
[mailto:philippe.vanpeperstraete@...]
    Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:48 AM
    To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit


    Did you look under the "documentation" tab, there, you'll find the JUnit
cookbook, which is a pretty good start, if you get your Java environment
straight.

    regards
    Philippe
      -----Original Message-----
      From: Ram Kumar [mailto:y_ramkumar@...]
      Sent: woensdag 30 mei 2001 16:33
      To: junit@yahoogroups.com
      Subject: Re: [junit] testing junit


      Hi,

      I am a new JUnit user and just downloaded JUnit and trying to work
with it. I could not find proper documentation about how to install JUnit
and use it, in JUnit site.

      Could any one suggest me where to find good documentation about JUnit?

      Awaiting your immediate reply.

      Thanks,

      Yamasani.
